H0.text: The color of the galaxy is the characteristic on which galaxy classification is based.

H1.text: The shape of the galaxy is the characteristic on which the classification of galaxies is based.

H2.text: How many stars make up the galaxy is the characteristic on which classification of galaxies is based.

H3.text: The number of planets that make up a galaxy is the characteristic on which classification of galaxies is based.

A4.text: the primary criteria used to assign the morphological type has been the nature of the spiral arms

A5.text: Another criticism of the Hubble classification scheme is that, being based on the appearance of a galaxy in a two-dimensional image, the classes are only indirectly related to the true physical properties of galaxies.
